pullRequest.body:
Show that $M_n(M_p(R))$ is isomorphic to $M_{np}(R)$, and generalisations of this statement.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: 

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

-->

### PR summary [7d98118e01](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14512/commits/7d98118e017b1f21525f0d101d68b1200cc54ff6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.Matrix.Composition`|761|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ comp`
`+ compAddEquiv`
`+ compAlgEquiv`
`+ compLinearEquiv`
`+ compRingEquiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

</details>

Welcome to mathlib; thanks for your contribution!
Can you give your PR a descriptive title (and perhaps add some description what this does), please? [This page](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/commit.html) describes in more detail what information would be helpful to have. This makes it much easier to review your work :-)
Once you've done that, feel free to mark you PR as `awaiting-review`, and a reviewer will look at it.

> Welcome to mathlib; thanks for your contribution! Can you give your PR a descriptive title (and perhaps add some description what this does), please? [This page](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/commit.html) describes in more detail what information would be helpful to have. This makes it much easier to review your work :-) Once you've done that, feel free to mark you PR as `awaiting-review`, and a reviewer will look at it.

Thanks and done! :)

Thanks a lot!

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by kbuzzard.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9971443075/job/27552546820)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9971443075/job/27552547376)
I think this is unnecessary now. (Untested)
fixed
Spacing is inconsistent
done
Maybe there should be a space before `[Fintype I]`
done
does `simpa` work?
nope
Maybe we should have linear map version as well
done
Does `Aesop` work?
yes
Why sudden change to `Fin n`
changed
You opened `MulOpposite` so probably `op` would work
done
Does a `MulHom` version make sense?
I don't think so without addition matrix multiplication makes no sence
I think the naming convention should be `compRingHom`
Any specific reasons? :(

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html

So this is a definition which means you should use camel case
ok done
Should we have some `simp` lemma such as `comp_apply` expressing what the ij-th entry look like
that would be way over 150 lines
Maybe you can tag the def as @[simps] to generate it automatically
good point! done

Can you include a new section like this
```
## Main results
```
done
Sorry, I haven’t made it clear. Module docs string is using markdown syntax. We typically include a section dedicated to list important results in the file.

```suggestion
  toFun M := op (M.transpose.map fun d => unop d)
  invFun M := (unop M).transpose.map fun d => op d
```
if you'd like - I think it's cleaner but that's subjective!
done
I'll guess `aesop` works for this whole proof? If not, the `ext i j` above should be on its own line.
no, `aesop` itself can't close the goal
Here @ symbol is used but no arguments are given. Is the @ symbol crucial here?
no this is only  what rw? gives
deleted
The first `n` is not written as subscript
hmmmm u r very thorough, done :)
Might be a stupid question, does a version exists for matrices that are not square shaped.
no because then the matrix is not a semiring anymore
Should we have a ringEquiv version?
Isn't that in the wedderburn file we are going to PR next
And now it's already over 150 lines
Ah okay
This should be compLinearEquiv and similarly for algEquiv
oh okay
Sorry for not spotting earlier this should be compRingEquiv I think
done
The documentation for the function is not very accurate, it seems to imply the function only works for square matrices
any suggestions?
Write a much longer docstring explaining what the declaration actually does. Long docstrings are fine.

```suggestion
/-- `Matrix.comp` as an `AddEquiv`. -/
```
is usually how we document these bundled operations.
Thanks for the tips!
done
Instead of just writing down the type, a more helpful docstring can be "n-by-n matrices over an opposite ring `R\op` is isomorphic to the opposite ring of n-by-n matrices over `R`"
done
if `MulOpposite` is more useful when opened, you can put it somewhere at the top of the file by `open MulOpposite` then you don't have to open it multiple times
it's only used here
ah okay
I think the dangling `}` should be at the end of line 52
done

Can you follow the conventions laid out [here](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/doc.html#header-comment) for the module docstring. In particular, start with a top-level header (not `##`), then a brief explanation of what the file does, then `## Main definitions` and document the main bijections you're constructing (see `Data/Matrix/Block.lean` for an example of what this should look like).
Good point! done！

```suggestion
  Matrix.reindex (.prodComm _ _) (.prodComm _ _) with
```
but again I'd prefer to see this in another file. Similarly for the other `swap` lemmas (assuming we don't have them -- I tried to check but loogle seems to be down right now)
deleted

This docstring does not accurately reflect the declaration at all; you are not composing the `Matrix` function with itself here. It's not clear to me that this declaration should exist at all; it's just `Matrix.reindex (.prodComm _ _) (.prodComm _ _)`. So I'm not entirely clear on whether making a new definition (which needs unfolding and API lemmas etc etc if it's made) is the best approach here. Even if it does then it's not clear to me that it should be in this file because it's not about composing `Matrix` with itself.
I think u r right we do have reindexAlgEquiv and reindexLinearEquiv
I'm just gonna delete them then
Agreed, I think this should be deleted.
done :)
Don't forget to push!
pushed :)

```suggestion
def compAddEquiv : Matrix I J (Matrix K L R) ≃+ Matrix (I × K) (J × L) R where
  __ := Matrix.comp I J K L R
  map_add' _ _ := rfl
```
is stylistically a little better, and otherwise identical (same throughout)
done :)

I think this should be called `transposeAlgEquiv'` or similar, since this is just a slightly more general version of the existing `transposeAlgEquiv`. Certainly the docstring should reference that definition.
done!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: matrices of matrices
